教学目的要求
LEARNING OBJECTIVES
There are three learning objectives of this course that relate to systems thinking and modelling:
1) Qualitative systems thinking skills,
2) Quantitative modelling skills, and
3) An understanding of the fundamental properties of integrated socio-economic and biophysical systems.
Skills covered will include:
• Appreciating the limitations of human computational capabilities in solving complex problems including bounded rationality.
• Developing understanding and proficiency in the use of computer simulation models.
• Defining system boundaries to address problems.
• Elucidating stock and flow variables.
• Identifying key variables in a system and the interrelationships among them.
• Drawing and interpreting causal loop and stock and flow diagrams.
• Recognizing the typical dynamic behaviour patterns and their underlying structural sources.
• Performing model calibration and validation, and experimenting with model assumptions.
• Performing scenario analyses.

预修课程

教材
Textbook:
Ford, A. (1999) Modeling the Environment: An Introduction to System Dynamics Modeling of Environmental Systems. Washington, DC: Island Press. 401 p.
Software:
In this course, students will be introduced to several software tools including MATLAB/SIMULINK, VENSIM and others, and mainly use the MATLAB and SIMULINK software of the MathWorks Inc. Student will be given instruction on the use of the software.

主要内容
ORGANIZATION of COURSE
The course has a lecture and a lab component. The class will meet for lectures for 3 hours each day in the first 5 days. Each day in the first 4 days, for one hour, the lab section will focus on developing and practicing modelling and simulation skills, and applying those skills to specific examples from different aspects of environmental and socio-economic issues. In the last day, for one hour, the group model project will be presented.
The course is fundamentally about developing systems thinking skills; therefore, key topics will be covered in a way that increases students’ ability to recognize and solve problems that are from different topics yet structurally similar. These topics will predominantly be drawn from the textbook; they will be lectured on in class, illustrated through in-class exercises, and used in homework exercises. Instructor will offer guidance and feedback throughout all these stages, with an emphasis on helping students frame their own problems and identify more sustainable policies or programs for management of different environmental issues.

COURSE EVALUATION and GRADING
Coursework will comprise the following. The percentages in parentheses indicate grade distribution of final grade:
Homework assignments (10%)
Lab assignments (35%)
Class participation (15%)
Group model project (40%)

主要内容
1. Ecohydrology: An Introduction
Provide an overview of ecohydrology in terms its definition, key research questions and general methodology with some examples and questions that can help to explain these concepts. The purpose of this presentation is to introduce ecoyhydrology as science discipline. The key questions include: why different ecosystems are found in the regions where they are now? How different drivers (e.g. climate) control water use and carbon fluxes? How do hydrological processes and ecological processes interact? Following from this introduction, it should become clear that we need to understand key ecohydrological processes such as movement of water, energy, and carbon.
2. Evapotranspiration: theory and applications
In this presentation, I will briefly review history and highlight some major breakthroughs of evapotranspiration research. Then I will discuss some basic concepts on evapotranspiration and describe the Monin-Obukhov similarity theory and energy balance principle. Following from the evaporation theory, I will present two case studies to demonstrate how one can use the Penman-Monteith equation and the generalized complementary relationship (GCR) model to estimate evapotranspiration.
3. Modelling ecohydrological processes using WAVES
Ecological processes are fully coupled with hydrological processes. As such, ecohydrology is a rapidly developing research field. In the presentation, I will briefly review development of ecohydrology and the key questions being addressed, ad future challenges. I will then introduce the WAVES model – an ecohydrological model and describe its application for dealing with some of the ecohydrological issues. The WAVES model was developed in CSIRO and it can be downloaded freely. Students may find the model potentially useful for their research projects.
4. Generalized Budyko framework over variable time scales
The Budyko framework has been widely used to estimate catchment scale evaporation for its simplicity and accuracy. The framework was initially developed for mean annual time scale to examine spatial patterns of catchment water balance. Attempts have been made to extend the framework to finer time scale by considering changes in catchment water storage and climatic variability. Zhang et al. (2008) generalized the Budyko framework based on the “demand and supply” concept. In this presentation, I will provide a brief overview of the Budyko framework and its applications. Then I will describe development of the generalized Budyko framework with case studies from Australian catchments.
5. Impact of changing ecohydrological processes on catchment-scale water balance
In this presentation, I will introduce the concept of non-stationarity using examples from Australia and present some case studies we published recently. I would consider this topic “advanced” as it deals with some current research challenges and the students may find it difficult to understand.
6. Evaluating hydrological consequences of land use change
Most of our catchments have been modified by human activities to some degrees and one of the most noticeable human activities is land use change. Studies have shown that land use changes can affect hydrological processes resulting unwanted consequences. Understanding hydrological consequences of land use change will help us to develop sustainable management plans. In this presentation, I will introduce a basic framework for evaluating land use change impact on water yield and present some case studies to demonstrate how the method can be used to quantify land use change impact on water yield.
7. Climate change and hydrological cycle
Climate change is a global challenge to sustainable development and understanding its impact on hydrological cycle is vital. This presentation will describe some of the current research on climate change and its impact on hydrological processes. In the presentation, I will focus on basic concepts and techniques used in hydroclimate projections and these include GCM selections, downscaling GCM outputs, and hydrological modelling.
8. Most influential environmental scientists and their accomplishments
This is not a technical presentation on a specific environmental subject. Rather it describes some of the most influential contemporary environmental scientists and their accomplishments. In this presentation, I will introduce Mikhai Budyko, John Monteith, John Philip, and Mike Raupach in terms of their philosophy, scientific contributions, and lifetime story. I will focus on their accomplishments and impacts on our science. I hope their stories will inspire us and provide insights into some of the environmental challenges facing us.

教学目的要求
教学目的和要求：
本课程是面向微电子学与固体电子学研究生以及本领域专业人士的高级强化课程。本课程主要讲授先进的Si基和Ge基CMOS器件的物理和工艺技术，包括Si、Ge器件中工艺导致的缺陷特性、先进器件隔离技术、先进器件的低频噪音表征、随机电信噪音、半导体材料和器件的辐照效应以及微电子和纳电子器件的最新进展和技术挑战等内容。

预修课程
半导体器件与物理、集成电路工艺

教材
待定

主要内容
内容提要：
6 modules of 4 h (50 min + 10 min break). The last module consists of 2 submodules of each 2 hours. Each modules will start with the basic definitions and the underlying physics. Several case studies will be explained and discussed.

Module 1: Structural properties of grown-in and process-induced defects in Si and Ge

Definitions and basic aspects of defects in semiconductors. Structural properties. Defect nucleation, growth and multiplications. Grown-in defects during crystal pulling. Oxygen, nitrogen and carbon in Si and Ge. Process-induced defects. Metallic contamination. Defect gettering techniques. Illustration of some characterization techniques.

Module 2: Technology of device isolation techniques

Overview of different devices isolation technologies such as LOCOS, poly-buffered LOCOS, trench isolation etc. Basic aspects associated with bird’s beak formation, gate oxide thinning, defect nucleation. Technological and design aspects of isolation structures. Applications of trench isolation.

Module 3: Low frequency noise characterization of advanced semiconductor devices

Physics related to fundamental noise mechanisms (white noise, 1/f noise, GR noise) in semiconductor materials and devices. Models for 1/f noise. Extraction of parameters related to the quality of the dielectrics and interfaces. Noise and reliability. Noise analysis of advanced CMOS devices like SOI devices, memory devices, FinFETs, tunneling FETs, nanowire transistors, 2D transistors etc.

Module 4: Random telegraph signals in semiconductor devices

Physics related to Random Telegraph Signals in semiconductors. RTS models. Extraction of the trap parameters. Discussion of RTS models. Analysis of RTS in advanced high performance and memory devices.

Module 5: Radiation effects in semiconductor materials and devices

Physics of radiation effects in semiconductor materials and devices. Definition of basic parameters. Electrical impact of ionizing radiation (total dose effects) and bulk damage. Radiation in advanced Si and Ge devices ( SOI, GeOI, FinFETs, TFETs etc).

Module 6a: Technological challenges and trends in micro- and nano-electronics

General trends in microelectronics. Need for new materials and alternative device architectures. Overview of devices required for the end of the road map. Technological and manufacturing challenges.

Module 6b: Basic aspects and trends for Internet of Things applications

Definition of Internet of Things. Device requirements. Discussion of examples related to automotive, agriculture, health care. General trends and market evolution.

教学目的要求
本课程为化学、材料学、微电子、集成电路等学科的交叉课程，通过讲述集成电路制造密切相关的关键分子材料基本概念和知识，要求学生掌握电子封装材料在IC制造和封装过程中的功能和用途，材料基本要求，以及封装制造工艺变革中电子封装材料的相关问题、解决办法和发展趋势。具体包括：封装的结构/基本工艺概述、引线键合材料、无铅含量、基板材料、底部填充胶、塑封料、导电胶、热界面材料、芯片粘结材料、埋入式器件、先进键合材料、柔性电子印刷材料、硅刻蚀材料和技术、材料可靠性评价等基础知识。

课程编码：192M7005H 英文名称：Fault-Tolerant Microelectronics 课时：20 学分：1.00 课程属性：高级强化课 主讲教师：Chen Li

教学目的要求
The students are expected to learn radiation effects in microelectronics and mitigation techniques. The course will cover the following topics:
1) Overview of the space and terrestrial radiation environment
2) Describe the basic radiation effects observed in semiconductor devices
3) Provide examples of radiation effects on complex microcircuits
4) Describe modeling techniques for single event effects
5) Describe examples and results of radiation hardened by design techniques
6) Review of radiation effects test techniques

预修课程
VLSI

教材
1. CMOS VLSI Design (Weste and Harris)
2. In-class handouts

主要内容
The course will be divided into 3 parts, the first part will introduce the space and terrestrial radiation environment, and the radiation effects in semiconductor devices. Some examples will be presented to the audience about radiation effects on complex microcircuits. This will take about 4 hours.
The second part will discuss the approaches to model the radiation effects and some mitigation approaches in digital and analog circuits. Simulation methods from nuclear physics, devices, circuit, and system level will be introduced. Mitigation approaches on both single event effects and TID will be discussed. This will take about 12 hours.
The last part will cover the radiation test techniques and overview of test facilities in Canada and China. This will include proton/neutron radiation facility and the pulsed laser facility. Basic testing methods will be introduced and explains. This will take about 4 hours.

参考文献
1. CMOS VLSI Design (Weste and Harris)
2. In-class handouts

详细内容:
稳态强磁场产生技术及其应用

课程编码：103M7004H 英文名称：Generation of Steady-State High Magnetic Field and Its Applications 课时：20 学分：1.00 课程属性：高级强化课 主讲教师：刘建华

教学目的要求
本课程是针对电气工程学科研究生进行的高级强化课。本课程从稳态强磁场产生装置的基本原理讲起，分别通过电阻磁体、超导磁体以及混合磁体等来介绍稳态强磁场的产生技术，包括磁场产生装置的基本结构、设计方法和关键技术，随后对稳态强磁场在核磁、物理、材料、医学以及生物工程等领域的应用进行详细介绍，最后对稳态强磁场技术领域的前沿热点技术进行介绍。通过学习本课程使学生初步掌握稳态强磁场产生技术的设计方法，把握最新前沿技术，了解其在世界范围内的应用情况。

预修课程
电路原理、电磁场分析

教材
自编。

主要内容
第一章稳态强磁场产生装置概览(4学时)
强磁场是现代科学实验最重要的极端条件之一，为物理、化学、材料和生物等学科研究提供了新途径，对于发现和认识新现象、揭示新规律具有重要作用。根据强磁场持续的时间长短又可以分为脉冲强磁场和稳态强磁场。稳态强磁场产生装置包括高功率水冷磁体、超导磁体以及混合磁体三大类。本报告主要从介绍磁场产生装置原理开始，逐步介绍各种稳态强磁场产生装置系统的基本构成，最后简单介绍稳态强磁场装置在核磁、物理、材料、国防、医学以及生物工程等方面的应用情况。
第二章稳态强磁场装置基本设计方法(4学时)
稳态强磁场发生装置在设计中除了考虑满足基本的电气参数设计、机械结构设计、低温系统设计、失超保护设计（超导磁体）和电流引线设计外，还要由于其极高的电流密度和磁场强度带来的极大电磁应力，这对支撑系统和导线提出了极为苛刻的要求。同时由于磁场升高带来的巨大储能也给系统的失超保护系统带来的挑战。如何在设计和工程建造过程中合理解决这些问题使稳态强磁场装置能稳定可靠地运行是本部分主要讲解的内容。

第三章稳态强磁场装置前沿技术分析(4学时)
科学技术的发展对磁场强度提出了越来越高的要求，现在由超导和水冷混合磁体能产生的稳态强磁场已达45 T，全超导磁体产生的稳态强磁场已达32 T。稳态强磁场装置由于其工作条件具有极低的温度（超导磁体）、极高的机械应力和极高的磁场强度，这些极端工作条件给系统装置的设计、建造工艺、电流引线、失超保护（超导磁体）、磁场质量以及稳定度等方面都带来了技术挑战。本报告主要介绍目前世界范围内在建造稳态强磁场装置过程中解决关键工程问题采用的前沿技术。
第四章稳态强磁场技术在医学和生命科学中的应用(4学时)
磁共振成像（MRI）技术是稳态强磁场技术影响最为广泛的医学应用。MRI是近年来出现的一种新型的高科技影像学检查方法，它具有无放射线损害、无骨性伪影、能多方向和多参数成像，具有高度的软组织分辨能力，无需使用对比剂即可显示血管结构等独特的优点。稳态强磁场技术还可以实现远程操纵导管或者胶囊机器人实现介入诊治，具有远程遥控手术、简化操作、减少X线辐射等优点，可应用于心脏消融、冠状动脉介入治疗、胃肠检查等介入治疗，具有极大的操控便利性。在生物医学领域，强磁场系统可以获得生命运行的本征特性和研究人类基本的认知科学。已有研究发现强磁场对生物体的组织、生化反应、生长过程、基因、细菌的新陈代谢等均能产生显著的影响，开展强磁场下生物工程的研究，对提升生物领域的研究水平和影响力，具有重要的意义
第五章稳态强磁场技术在其他领域的应用
强磁场对科学技术的发展具有极其重要的作用，它孕育着许多重大的科学发现和新技术的产生。强磁场所带来的诸多优点使得人类对于物质世界认识不断加深，对于生命的起源以及从事疾病防治的研究都有特别重要的意义。此章节课程将使学生对稳态强磁场装置，尤其是超导磁体，在材料、物理、国防、医学等领域的应用有一个系统而且深入的学习和了解。强磁场的产生和应用研究对极端条件科学设施、生物医学工程、国防特种装备、高精度的科学仪器以及农业应用等方面都具有重要的意义和广阔的前景。

药物基因组学进展

课程编码：061M7018H 英文名称：Advances in Pharmacogenomics 课时：20 学分：1.00 课程属性：高级强化课 主讲教师：周凯欣

教学目的要求
随着基因组学技术的进步和大规模GWAS研究的推广，药物基因组学也从传统的ADME研究范式进入了全基因组扫描时代。同时，电子病历和多组学数据的快速积累为药物基因组学拓展了贯穿药物研发到临床使用全过程的诸多全新应用，药物基因组学研究已经成为世界主要跨国药企突破创新药物研发瓶颈的第一手段。

尽管大量相关人才近期从传统的科研机构流入药企研发部门，仍不能满足企业研发团队建设的迫切需求。本课程面对遗传学、基因组学、药学和生物信息学相关专业的研究生，在简要回顾药物基因组学发展历史的基础上，重点介绍当前药物基因组学的理论研究现状和主要产业应用，讲述药物基因组学研究在创新药物研发中的成功案例。鼓励学生以科研成果转化为导向，开展多学科交叉应用研究，为我国药物研发行业的崛起培养具有创新思维的后备人才。

预修课程
对遗传学、基因组学、药学和生物信息学中的一个或多个研究方向有较好的理解，能高效阅读相关领域的英文文献。

课程编码：051M7020H 英文名称：Crystal Structure Analysis 课时：20 学分：1.00 课程属性：高级强化课 主讲教师：沈仲鑫

教学目的要求
What you should know as follows: Index planes. Calculate crystal density.Calculate d-spacings. Derive/use Bragg’s Law. Index diffraction peaks. Determine lattice constants. Reciprocal lattice. Ewald sphere construction. Calculate structure factors, predicting X-ray diffraction pattern (systematic absences). Use of Scherrer relation.

预修课程

教材
从美国麻省理工学院（MIT）网站上搜到的课件, 以及教师本人已经在北京爱迪科森公司出版的视频。

主要内容
课程简介：2019年夏季学期由资深教授沈仲鑫主讲的“晶体结构分析”课程将会从大家熟知的X射线胸透话起，叙述钻石或单晶硅的结构，硅酸盐矿物晶体和宝石的物理性质，认识晶体的结构和缺陷；以及Pauling 规则的应用。晶体和对称，纯物质的相和二元相图。X射线产生的基本原理和实践，既讲X射线衍射的Bragg方程如何用于多晶材料结构分析（粉末法），也讲Laue方程如何用于单晶材料定向（旋转晶体法），介绍同步辐射光源的应用。课程会讲解和归纳倒易晶格的矢量分析，并应用至Ewald sphere中，清晰地解释衍射峰强度与衍射角之间的几何关系，综合描述衍射样品的制备及衍射仪设备的安置，如何扫描薄膜和表面织构，以及小角散射和电子密度图等，也讲原子散射因子和几何结构因子的计算，并介绍电子衍射和中子衍射，X射线光电子能谱（XPS）, 和二次离子质谱（SIMS）等技术在晶体结构分析方面的应用。

师资水平：资深教师，思路敏捷，表达清晰，知识面较广，具有40余年教学经验，长期任教于加州大学和旧金山州立大学（讲授“电磁学（Electromagnetics)”，“无机化学(Inorganic Chemistry)”，“分析化学(Analytical Chemistry)”，和“物理化学(Physical Chemistry)”等课程）和中科院大学等院校， 讲授“光纤和激光技术导论”，“激光材料加工原理”，“能源技术概论”, 和“应用物理化学引论”等课程，曾任教于复旦大学和同济大学（执教“结构化学(Structural Chemistry)”和“玻璃表面物理化学(Physical Chemistry of Glass Surfaces)”等课程），以及任职于硅谷“应用光纤光学”等公司的中层经理，具有教学，科研和产业三方面的实践经验

学时安排：
I. （4 学时）Introduction to Crystals. Diamonds (42 ppt). Physical Properties of Mineral Crystals (40 ppt). Silicate Minerals and Gems (50 ppt). Beryl (48 ppt). (07/08/2019)
II. （4 学时）Crystal Structure (60 ppt). Crystal Defects (105 ppt). Pauling Rules (19 ppt). Crystals and Symmetry (167 ppt). (07/09/2019)
III. （4 学时）Introduction to X-ray Diffraction.（124 ppt）What is X-ray Diffraction. Properties and Generation of X-ray. Bragg’s Law. Basics of Crystallography. XRD Pattern. Powder Diffraction. Applications of XRD: Qualitative analysis. Quantitative analysis. Crystal structure determination. Crystallite size. Microstrain. Residual macrostresses. Thin films. Crystallinity. Studies of phase diagrams (A. Phase boundaries, B. Solid solutions, C. Phase transitions). Studies of chemical reactions and identification of reaction products. Determination of grain sizes. Preferred orientation in polycrystalline bodies. Introduction to Powder XRD (43 ppt). (07/10/2019).
IV. （4 学时）Basics of XRD (76 ppt from MIT). Basics of X-ray Powder Diffraction (97 pdf from MIT). (07/11/2019).
V. （4 学时） Principles and Practices of X-ray Diffraction (101 ppt). Neutron Diffraction (46 ppt ). Single Crystal Analysis (43 ppt). Crystal Structure Analysis (156 pdf ): XRD, Electron Diffraction. Neutron Diffraction. X-ray Patterns (35 ppt). Applications (35 ppt). Topic 5a - XRD ( 47 pdf ). XPS (60 ppt). (07/12/2019).

选课先知：
由于“晶体结构分析”在第4周，为了鼓励大家选这门课，主讲老师决定，对选该课程的前15名同学给予奖励，奖品为值得永久纪念的物件。

本课程也提供精美的PPT来描述大家感兴趣的钻石，翡翠，和硅酸盐矿物晶体的形貌和结构等。所有课件对大家公开，可以任意复制和选用。

Charl F. J. Faul is Professor of Materials Chemistry for the School of Chemistry, University of Bristol, UK. He received his PhD from the University of Stellenbosch, South Africa, in 2000. After 4 years, first as post-doctoral researcher, and then as senior scientist at the Max Planck Institute of Colloids and Interfaces (Potsdam, Germany), he moved to Bristol in 2005. He held visiting professorships at the Helsinki University of Technology (2006 – 2010), the Chinese Academy of Sciences (National Centre for Nanoscience and Technology, Beijing, 2012) and the University of Rennes, France (2018), and is Adjunct Professor at the Department of Chemistry, Tsinghua University, Beijing, since November 2013. He is co-Principal Investigator and member of the Management Board of the ￡12M EPSRC-funded centre for doctoral training, the Bristol Centre for Functional Nanomaterials (BCFN), and served as Director of Graduate Recruitment for the School of Chemistry for 5 years (2013-2018). As Head of Inorganic and Materials Chemistry (since August 2018) he is part of the senior management team of the School of Chemistry.

Charl is a synthetic materials chemist with a multidisciplinary international research group focusing on the design and synthesis of redox-active functional materials. His activities range from fundamental to application-driven areas, where hierarchical self-assembly and the design and synthesis of electroactive nanomaterials are explored. Applications are actively pursued in the areas of conjugated microporous materials for gas storage (CO2 capture, storage, conversion), and electroactive materials and devices (nanowire-based field-effect transistors, 3D-printed addressable photonic structures and soft actuators for robotics).

Charl has very strong connections to China: in addition to his collaboration with prof WEI Zhixiang, and Visiting Professorship to the National Centre for Nanoscience and Technology in 2012, he collaborates closely with prof ZHANG Xi (formerly from the Department of Chemistry, Tsinghua University, and now President of Jilin University, Changchun). He will take up a visiting professorship at the College of Chemistry, Jilin University, in July 2019, and was very recently awarded a Royal Society International Exchange Joint Project with Prof LIU Kun from the State Key Laboratory for Supramolecular Materials and Structures, at Jilin University. Charl has been to China more than 40 times since 2007!

主要内容
第一部分 复变函数论 （20-22学时）
1. 复变函数（连续性、可微性、解析函数、Cauchy-Riemann方程、初等函数）
2. 复变函数的积分（复积分、Cauchy定理和Cauchy积分公式）
3. 复级数（复级数、Taylor级数、Laurent级数）
4. 留数定理及其应用（解析函数零点、留数（Residues）、留数定理、奇点、留数求法、留数定理的应用（实积分的计算、三角函数积分、Jordan引理））


第二部分 数学物理方程（58-60学时）
第1章 数学物理方程定解问题（8学时）
1）三个典型方程的导出（弦振动、热传导问题、静电场问题）
2）定解问题及其适定性（通解和特解、定解条件、定解问题及其适定性）
3）二阶线性偏微分方程的分类和标准形式（特征方程和特征线、方程的分类、化简和标准形式）
4）叠加原理和齐次化原理（线性叠加原理、齐次化原理（Duhamel原理））

第2章 分离变量法（6学时）
1）典型例子（两端固定弦振动、圆柱体稳态温度分布）
2）一般格式、特征值问题（Sturm-Liouville问题）
3）非齐次问题
4）物理意义、驻波法与共振

第3章 特殊函数及其应用（14学时）
1）正交曲线坐标下的变量分离（Helmholtz方程在直角坐标下的变量分离及高维Fourier展开、Helmholtz方程在柱坐标系下的变量分离及Bessel方程的导出、Helmholtz方程在球坐标系下的变量分离及Legendre方程的导出）
2）常微分方程的幂级数解（二阶线性ODEs的解析理论、Legendre方程的幂级数解及Legendre函数、Bessel方程的广义幂级数解及Bessel函数）
3）Legendre函数与球调和函数及其性质
4）Bessel函数与柱函数及其性质

第4章 积分变换法（8学时）
1）Fourier变换法（Fourier变换与逆变换、Fourier变换的应用（求解无界区间上的定解问题）、Fourier正弦和余弦变换与半无界区间上的定解问题）
2）Laplace变换法（Laplace变换与逆变换及其性质、用Laplace变换求解发展方程的定解问题）

第5章 波动方程的行波法、球面平均法和降维法（6-8学时）
1）波动方程的行波法（达朗贝尔（d’Alembert）公式及其物理意义、延拓法、球面波等）
2）三维波动方程的球面平均法（球对称解、Poisson公式）
3）二维波动方程的降维法
4）Poisson公式的物理意义、惠更斯（Huygens）原理

第6章 位势方程的Green函数法（8学时）
1）Dirac delta函数、广义函数简介（定义、性质与运算、高维情形）
2）全空间问题的Green函数（基本解）（基本解及解的积分表达式、基本解的求法）
3）边值问题的Green函数法（位势方程边值问题的Green函数及解的积分公式、Green函数的求解法）

第7章 变分法（8学时）
1）泛函的概念、泛函极值及例子
2）泛函的变分、Euler方程和边界条件
3）泛函的条件极值
4）微分方程定解问题和特征值问题的变分形式
5）瑞利-里兹（Rayleigh-Ritz）方法

“综合物理实验”内容包含集中授课（6学时）、实验操作培训（4学时）、实践（68学时）与考核（2学时）四部分，共计80学时（4学分）。实践要求为：
1. 去实验室之前，应查阅相关背景文献，初步了解仪器和实验方法的基本原理。
2. 参加常用仪器基本操作培训，了解基本操作在专业仪器中的重要作用。能够掌握真空、高温高电压/低温、弱信号发生与测量等仪器的操作方法，能够避免错误操作给专业仪器带来的风险。
3. 确定感兴趣的实验室，深入到实验室，在指导教师的总体安排下，通过观察思考、交流讨论、动手试验等方法，了解科学实验的全过程，逐步掌握科学思想和科学方法，培养学生独立实验的能力和运用所学知识解决给定问题的能力。
4. 实践之后，形成一份实践报告，并面向2015级同学做口头报告交流。
5. 遵守学术道德规范，养成一丝不苟的实验习惯，坚持实事求是的科学作风。
6. 遵守各项安全规章，规范操作仪器，保障人身安全以及仪器设备的安全。

预修课程

主要内容
教 材
《C程序设计语言》（第2版•新版）
[美] Brian W.Kernighan（布莱恩•克尼汉），[美] Dennis M.Ritchie（丹尼斯•里奇） 著； 徐宝文，李志 译

主要内容
作为全校通选课，考虑到不同专业学生未来研究的需求，讲授内容覆盖：
---命令式（imperative）程序设计
---面向对象程序设计（Java班是主要内容）
---GNU的编程风格/Windows下的编程风格；

讲授内容设置的总体原则是“零基础的学生能快速上手；有基础的学生能够吃得饱”。

课程讲授风格与理念
与数学、物理等理论型课程不同，《程序设计》是一门实践性很强的课程。
拟采用“teaching by coding, learning by coding”的讲授风格，即“观摩高手编程、现场实战教学”，以克服普通高校编程教学中“纸上谈兵”的缺陷；授课中大部分时间（约70%）是实战型教学，约30%的时间是ppt课件讲授；

在讲授语言及编程时，我们拟注重从如下4个维度讲授：
--- 系统的角度：从CPU、操作系统的角度看程序行为，比如程序运行时内存映像；从缓冲区攻击的角度看程序运行时行为等；
--- 编译的角度：从编译器的角度看，不同的程序设计所导致的程序行为之异同；

详细内容:
星间激光干涉测距技术

课程编码：032M3001H 英文名称：Intersatellite Laser Interferometric Ranging Technology 课时：30 学分：1.00 课程属性：专业研讨课 主讲教师：靳刚

教学目的要求
1. 了解与掌握相对论与时空、黎曼几何、爱因斯坦方程、测地线方程、广义相对论的三大预研及实验验证、黑洞、引力波概念；
2. 了解引力波频谱、引力波探测发展史、数据处理与幅值谱密度；掌握激光干涉引力波探测方案基本原理、脉冲星计时阵列探测方案基本原理、宇宙微波背景辐射B模探测基本原理；
3. 以地面激光干涉引力波天线LIGO、Advanced LIGO为例，介绍地面激光干涉引力波探测原理、系统构成、噪声源与抑制途径；介绍VIRGO、GEO600、TAMA300以及AIGO等探测计划的基本情况；
4. 以空间激光干涉引力波天线LISA为例，介绍空间激光干涉引力波探测的系统构成；介绍太极计划、天琴计划、DEDIGO、BBO等探测计划的基本情况；
5. 介绍星间激光干涉测距技术基本原理、构成及系统指标，关键技术和噪声源。包括：高稳频激光器、Pound-Drever-Hall预稳、激光锁臂(Laser Arm-locking)、Time Delay Interferometer、星间绝对距离测量与激光通讯、激光干涉仪、低噪弱光探测器、相位计、时钟噪声消除、超前角指向机构、激光望远镜、光学装配跟踪机构、星座捕获、激光指向控制、激光弱光锁相控制、TTL(Tilt-to-length)等关键技术。
通过星间激光干涉测距技术，学生可了解引力波及探测相关技术的基本概念，以此进行相关研讨课题。
